title: Solano County MEHKO
description: Home-based restaurant permit for up to 30 meals/day or 90 meals/week, max $100,000 annual sales. No signage; food must be prepared, cooked, and served/delivered the same day.

steps.title: Plan Your MEHKO
steps.content:
**What to do:** Confirm you can run a MEHKO at home and understand county limits.

**Why it matters:** You must operate within MEHKO rules to be approved and stay compliant.

**What you need:**
- ☐ Residence in Solano County
- ☐ Menu and production plan (≤30/day, ≤90/week)
- ☐ Kitchen setup meeting food safety standards

**Where/how:** Review Solano County’s MEHKO information page.

**Cost & time:** $0 · 10–30 minutes planning

**Ready when:** You can state your daily/weekly meal volume within limits.
searchTerms: Solano County MEHKO daily meal limits
Solano County Home Kitchen Operations rules

steps.title: Approvals & Training
steps.content:
**What to do:** Obtain a Certified Food Protection Manager (CFPM) credential and any needed approvals.

**Why it matters:** Certification and permissions are required for approval.

**What you need:**
- ☐ CFPM certificate (ANSI-CFP recognized)
- ☐ Property owner/landlord approval if renting
- ☐ City business license if required

**Where/how:** Take an ANSI-approved CFPM course; confirm any property or business license requirements.

**Cost & time:** ~$60–$90 · 1–2 days total

**Ready when:** You have your CFPM certificate and necessary approvals.
searchTerms: Solano County business license home kitchen

steps.title: Prepare Required Documents
steps.content:
**What to do:** Gather the documents you’ll submit with your application.

**Why it matters:** Incomplete submissions delay review and inspection.

**What you need:**
- ☐ SOP form — go to Step 4: Standard Operating Procedures (SOP)
- ☐ Health Permit Application — go to Step 5: Health Permit Application
- ☐ CFPM certificate (from Step 2: Approvals & Training)
- ☐ Proof of residency (ID and utility bill)

**Where/how:** Collect all documents as PDFs or hard copies.

**Cost & time:** $0 · 30–60 minutes

**Ready when:** All documents are filled, signed, and stored.

steps.title: Standard Operating Procedures (SOP)
steps.content:
**What to do:** Fill the SOP form covering menu, prep, storage, sanitation, and operations.

**Why it matters:** Shows the county how you will keep food safe at home.

**What you need:**
- ☐ Menu and ingredients list
- ☐ Cooking/cooling/holding details
- ☐ Cleaning/sanitizing plan; handwashing setup

**Where/how:** Complete the SOP form linked in this step.

**Cost & time:** $0 · 30–60 minutes

**Ready when:** SOP is complete and consistent with your operation.

steps.title: Health Permit Application
steps.content:
**What to do:** Complete the MEHKO Facility Application for a Health Permit.

**Why it matters:** This is the official request to operate.

**What you need:**
- ☐ Owner and site details
- ☐ CFPM certificate info
- ☐ SOP — go to Step 4: Standard Operating Procedures (SOP)

**Where/how:** Fill out and sign the application; submit with SOP.

**Cost & time:** $0 to fill · 15–30 minutes

**Ready when:** Application is complete and consistent with your SOP.
searchTerms: Solano County Home Kitchen application form

steps.title: Submit Application & Fees
steps.content:
**What to do:** Submit the completed packet and pay required fees.

**Why it matters:** The county processes your permit after submission and payment.

**What you need:**
- ☐ Completed Application — go to Step 5: Health Permit Application
- ☐ Completed SOP — go to Step 4: Standard Operating Procedures (SOP)
- ☐ CFPM certificate
- ☐ Proof of residence
- ☐ Payment method

**Where/how:** Submit to Solano County Environmental Health, 675 Texas Street, Suite 5500, Fairfield, CA 94533. Phone (707) 784-6765.

**Cost & time:** Initial Permit $650 · Annual Renewal $325 (per fee schedule) · 10–20 minutes

**Ready when:** County confirms receipt and payment.

steps.title: Schedule & Pass Inspection
steps.content:
**What to do:** Schedule a home kitchen inspection with Environmental Health.

**Why it matters:** Passing inspection is required before operating.

**What you need:**
- ☐ Kitchen ready per SOP
- ☐ Thermometer, sanitizer, handwash setup
- ☐ Required equipment functional

**Where/how:** The department will provide scheduling details after application approval.

**Cost & time:** Included in permit fee · 1–2 hours

**Ready when:** You receive a pass and resolve corrections.

steps.title: Receive Permit
steps.content:
**What to do:** Get your MEHKO permit after passing inspection.

**Why it matters:** You must have a valid permit to operate.

**What you need:**
- ☐ Approval notice
- ☐ Permit document

**Where/how:** Issued by Solano County Environmental Health after inspection.

**Cost & time:** $0 (after fees)

**Ready when:** You have the permit in hand.

steps.title: Operate & Stay Compliant
steps.content:
**What to do:** Follow your SOP, stay within limits, and renew annually.

**Why it matters:** Protects your customers and keeps your permit valid.

**What you need:**
- ☐ Meal logs ≤30/day and ≤90/week
- ☐ Temperature & cleaning records
- ☐ Permit renewal reminder

**Where/how:** Maintain records; update SOP if menu/volume changes.

**Cost & time:** Renewal $325 annually · ongoing

**Ready when:** Records are current and renewal submitted.

steps.title: Contact Info
steps.content:
**What to do:** Use the contact information below for questions and assistance.

**Why it matters:** County staff can guide you through the process.

**What you need:**
- ☐ Phone/email
- ☐ Office location
- ☐ Website

**Where/how:** Solano County Environmental Health — 675 Texas Street, Suite 5500, Fairfield, CA 94533 · Phone: (707) 784-6765 · Email: EH@SolanoCounty.com.

**Cost & time:** $0 · varies

**Ready when:** You have the information needed to proceed.
